newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania c.bank denies report on governor quitting.
newsitem.headline: Romania c.bank denies report on governor quitting.

text.p: Romania's central bank (BNR) on Thursday denied a newspaper report saying BNR governor Mugur Isarescu might resign in the next two or three months.
"The statement in the newspaper is not the governor's," BNR spokesman Adrian Vasilescu told Reuters.
The daily Evenimentul Zilei said Isarescu, in an exclusive statement, had confirmed speculation that he was planning to quit his job before his mandate expired.
Isarescu, one of the few Romanian officials who has remained in his position since the 1989 fall of communism, was appointed BNR governor in July 1991.
His links to the previously ruling communists appear to be one of possible motives for anyone to seek his removal. Government officials were not immediately available for comment on the report.
Under Romania's banking legislation, the term of office for the BNR governor is eight years.
